mass.description: The mass of the bullet. This affects the bullet's momentum and how it's affected by gravity and drag.

diameter.description: The diameter of the bullet. This affects the bullet's cross-sectional area and thus its drag.

muzzleVelocity.description: The initial velocity of the bullet as it leaves the muzzle. This is one of the most important factors in determining the bullet's trajectory.

launchAngle.description: The angle at which the bullet is launched relative to the horizontal. Positive values are above the horizontal, negative values are below.

windSpeed.description: The speed of the wind. This affects the bullet's trajectory by pushing it sideways.

windDirection.description: The direction of the wind in degrees. 0째 is directly from the front, 90째 is from the right, 180째 is from behind, and 270째 is from the left.

latitude.description: The latitude of the shooting location. This affects the Coriolis effect on the bullet's trajectory.

scopeHeight.description: The height of the scope above the barrel. This affects the point of impact as the bullet's trajectory is below the scope's line of sight.

dragCoefficient.description: The drag coefficient of the bullet. This affects how much the bullet is slowed down by air resistance.

tableMaxRange.description: The maximum range to show in the trajectory table. This determines how far the table extends.

tableInterval.description: The interval between rows in the trajectory table. This determines the spacing of data points in the table.

zeroRange.description: The range at which to calculate the zero angle. This is the distance at which you want the bullet to hit the target.
